meanings.definition: To make or become fat or fatter.
meanings.sent1: I feed my cat extra food to fatten him up.
meanings.sent2: The farmer fatten the pig before selling it.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to fatten up for winter by collecting more nuts.
meanings.sent4: The savings account started to fatten up with interest.
meanings.sent5: The chef used butter to fatten up the sauce for extra flavor.

meanings.definition: To increase in size or weight.
meanings.sent1: The balloon started to fatten as more air was blown into it.
meanings.sent2: The population of the town began to fatten with new residents.
meanings.sent3: The cloud seemed to fatten up before the storm.
meanings.sent4: The rumor started to fatten as it spread through the school.
meanings.sent5: The river fatten with rainwater after the storm.
